events.message: The applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses and consolidate existing debts.
The loan application was reviewed and categorized under Personal Loan to address the applicant's financial needs.
A loan officer was assigned to assist the applicant in navigating the personal loan process and required documentation.
The loan officer has conducted an initial review focusing on the applicant’s financial background and loan requirements.
Additional documents including proof of income, medical bills, and debt statements have been requested from the applicant.
The applicant submitted all requested documents, including recent pay stubs, hospital invoices, and debt account summaries.
Credit bureau report was obtained and evaluated, showing the applicant’s credit score and payment history for assessment.
The risk assessment considered applicant’s income stability, credit score, and outstanding debts to evaluate loan viability.
Based on the review, a loan offer with defined interest rate and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant.
The applicant responded positively, requesting minor adjustments to the repayment term for better affordability.
The loan case was escalated to the underwriting manager for approval of requested repayment term adjustments.
The adjusted loan application was approved following underwriting manager review and compliance checks.
Funds from the approved personal loan were successfully transferred to the applicant’s designated bank account.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant received the loan funds and understood the repayment schedule.
The loan application process was officially closed after successful disbursal and follow-up confirmation.
